title: Pleurotus ostreatus
summary: Pleurotus ostreatus, the oyster mushroom, oyster fungus, or hiratake, is a common edible mushroom.[2] It was first cultivated in Germany as a subsistence measure during World War I[3] and is now grown commercially around the world for food. It is related to the similarly cultivated king oyster mushroom. Oyster mushrooms can also be used industrially for mycoremediation purposes.
